column5: Smaller lakes I like trolling small harnesses.  I usually do well. Crank baits I love hot n tots - any color.  Last year I started using Live Target smelt jointed 4 1/2" silver with a hint of blue.  Landed some nice eyes on Erie.  I'm wanting to try the live target on Pidgeon.
No one vote for the flicker shad? They seem to be highly rated, but never tried them myself.
I fish alot of current. Flicker shads suck in current.  Awesome on weedlines in lakes though  But still nowhere near my go too
Suspending shad rap SSR#7 !!!!! Awesome  Third vote for the shad raps.  Jointed especially (perch and shad colorus)
huge fan of both flicker shads and flicker minnows   Dan
MR07  Rapala Minnow Rap, Hot Steel i throw on bleeding trebles...im only posting this now because i lost my all time fave this weekend...so sad
Biggest purple Rapala Taildancer I can find.
Powerdive minnows

I don't believe that they make power dive's any more... great Quinte fall lure. Op, I like different cranks depending mostly on time of year/water temps. Warm water above 60F, a tight wobbling crank like the above mentioned Power Dives or a Shad R etc... Cold water, below 60f down to freeze, a wider wobbling bait like a Mann's Stretch 20 or 30 tail dancer etc... HH

I don't believe that they make power dive's any more... great Quinte fall lure. Op, I like different cranks depending mostly on time of year/water temps. Warm water above 60F, a tight wobbling crank like the above mentioned Power Dives or a Shad R etc... Cold water, below 60f down to freeze, a wider wobbling bait like a Mann's Stretch 20 or 30 tail dancer etc... HH  You are correct they are discontinued, but a great lure here on erie
lots and lots of responses.  unless I missed it, not one for Yozuri Crystal Minnow DD.  If I was allowed only one lure, casting, trolling, etc, it would be the clown Crystal Minnow DD.
Not 1 mention of the original floating rapala black/gold?  Was an awesome lure when I was a teen!  I just recently added a couple to my tackle bag.  Gonna try them this Friday on Erie.

That's an incredible variety. I'm heading out to Rice lake this weekend and luckily for me I have most of what has been mentioned already.  What about any favourites for Rice this time of year? And what about methods, does one method out perform another? On Rice.....  Best crank bar none = Rapala shad rap SR05 in HOT STEEL. Slow retrieve, I mean very slow retrieve.  But instead of running crank baits, try using a basic black bucktail jig. Get 10 -15 ft into the edge of a weed line, any weed line don't matter the depth and just let it fall to the bottom and rip it back up.
What colour of Black Bucktail is that Ron.
Beautiful
It never gets old. Canadian Wiggler. I like the "updated" one with the hammered silver pattern and rattles inside. Great for walleye and pike and even muskie
Thanks for the tip Ron.

It never gets old. Canadian Wiggler. I like the "updated" one with the hammered silver pattern and rattles inside. Great for walleye and pike and even muskie  I like the jointed ones on Erie, they can handle a good speed unlike other Flatfish and Kwikfish lures. Big plus is that they last and last unlike some of the the baits mentioned.
What's your guys favourite crank bait for walleyes looking to buy some more and wanted to know what ones you guys do good with  Thanks
If I had to choose one it would be a rapala countdown minnow in the minnow pattern
800 series ReefRunner. There's nothing better...so far.
My no.1 is a size 9 Husky Jerk in gold/black, number 2 is a perch wally diver.
Either Rebel/Live Target/Big-O crayfish colour. Run it along the weedlines or bounce the nose off of rocks.
for northern lakes a rapala j-7 or j-9 in black/gold or charteuse,,,,lake erie reefrunner  800 series,or ripstick in orange crush,kryptonite,purple demon  or rapala taildancers in blues and greens.
Perch pattern HotnTot
Rapala J-11 in gold/black.
This year none of them working well on Pigeon Lake. Previous years ReefRunner, Shadrap, Walleye Diver.
Suspending shad rap SSR#7 !!!!! Awesome
X rap .....this spring i had good success with a live target perch.
Old school but I  get quite a few on a good old jointed Canadian Wiggler.   that or a firetiger Hot n Tot
CC Shad Perch
Glow frog taildancer. TD7 or 9.  S.
Casting? Trolling? Dirty water? Clear water? Target depth? Fishing structure or open water?  I like the 20 foot taildancers but recently have been doing well with deep thundersticks...
For a long time on this side of Lake Erie? all you needed was a storm wiggle wart or hot n tot, chrome and black or gold and black.
Thats why I picked what I picked lol. It will work in all those conditions, but certainly not my favorite crank
For my style of fishing, Shad Rap for me...perch or chartreuse.

Second on Shad Raps, but where I target 'Eyes- can't beat a husky Jerk, or Smithwick Rogue trolled over rock humps at night- any colour really but I like the glow purple or chartreuse HJ's, Smithwicks hook better...
HJ 12 gold, black back.
I like the various Live Target smelt baits.

That's an incredible variety. I'm heading out to Rice lake this weekend and luckily for me I have most of what has been mentioned already.  What about any favourites for Rice this time of year? And what about methods, does one method out perform another?
goldbrick shad rap
Glow frog taildancer, white big O, but if you want eyes, troll some worm harnesses along the weed edges.  Its been kinda slow on rice lately, but the fish are there.  S.
When in doubt use a Big O----cray or white.
